channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+3970] Couch Surfing! (Pic)
[+3836] Classified US military video depicting slaying of Iraqis
item.description: WikiLeaks has released a classified US military video depicting the indiscriminate slaying of over a dozen people in the Iraqi suburb of New Baghdad -- including two Reuters news staff.

item.title: [+2645] Penny Dome [pic]
[+2585] Update from Jay
item.description: Got some news. After five years, forty million users, and an amazingride, I've decided to step down as CEO of Digg.

item.title: [+2089] Why I won't buy an iPad (and think you shouldn't, either) -
item.description: If you want to live in the creative universe where anyone with a cool idea can make it and give it to you to run on your hardware, the iPad isn't for you.If you want to write code for a platform where the only thing that determines whether you're going to succeed with it is whether your audience loves it, the iPad isn't for you.

item.title: [+1949] Apple holding iPhone OS 4 event, April 8th!
item.description: Developing... OMG. (Josh [Engadget Editor] actually said this...)

item.title: [+1720] xkcd: Seismic Waves
item.description: The USGS operates a really neat email/SMS earthquake notification service (earthquake.usgs.gov/ens/) that allows fine-grained control of notifiations.

item.title: [+1655] Will It Blend? Watch iPad Meet a Blender.
[+1600] Anti-Obama Doctor Admits He Doesn't Know Much About HCR Law
item.description: Cassell: Well you know, I can't tell you exactly what the deal is. Colmes: If you can't tell us exactly what the deal is, why are you opposing it and fighting against it?What a good question.

item.title: [+1576] Recursive Wheaton (PIC)
[+1418] Another Wonderful New Google Feature (PIC)
item.description: Gotta love little additions like this that can help thousands.

item.title: [+1402] The 10 Funniest 'Teabonics' Protest Signs
item.description: "Teabonics" is a linguistic phenomenon that began around 2008, when Obama birthers started showing up outside of Sarah Palin rallies with handmade signs, usually featuring one or more egregious misspellings.

item.title: [+1288] Australians Are Good At Disputing Parking Tickets
item.description: Here’s a pretty killer letter to the city of Melbourne from a resident who received a parking ticket within the thirty seconds he parked his car and tried to put money in the meter.

item.title: [+1143] Starcraft 2 Ultralisk is a BEAST – rapes 800 Zerglings
item.description: The Ultralisk in Starcraft 2 is a BEAST! I am rarely impressed by short vids of unit combats but when 1 unit can destroy 798 zerglings, that is impressive.

item.title: [+846] Not sure what they are doing
[+774] Boys in Afghanistan have never seen their own photos [PICS]
item.description: For the first hour, no girls were to be seen, but the boys wanted their photos taken. Many villagers have never had their photos taken. The boys didn’t seem to know what the camera was until they saw their images.The villagers love to get the shots which often are the only photos they have ever owned. Soldiers use a Polaroid camera to take them

item.title: [+772] What Has Happened With Cell Phones This Decade (PIC)
item.description: A look at cell phones from 2000-2009

item.title: [+734] "I Just Won a Shit Load of Money"
[+701] I'm Having a Secret Weed Affair with My Boss
item.description: I’m involved with an older man. My boss, actually. Each week, we secretly meet outside of work, behind closed doors, away from the prying eyes of the world. Though ours is not a rendezvous of the heart. No, what we share is more special than clandestine candle lit dinners, fine wine on a beach, or roses petals on pillows. We smoke pot together.

item.title: [+678] Off the Foot ... THROUGH THE LEGS?!?! (Vid)
item.description: Hyperbole gets thrown around about "play of the year" type stuff in every sport during the first week of the season -- usually it's just something incredible that reminds us said sport is here. But there's a pretty good chance you want see a play more ridiculous than what Mark Buehrle pulled off on Opening Day.
